biscuit_food.name: Fish Biscuits
biscuit_food.desc:
Restores all HP when consumed. Fish Biscuits are small, compact wafers made of delicious wild berries, soy protein, bacon fat, and high fructose corn syrup. "Fish Biscuits: They're what fish crave!"
Cook thoroughly before eating. Do not consume while pregnant. Consult your doctor before use. Fish Biscuits cannot be used as a tourniquet, or during combat.

reset_stone.name: Level Reset Stone
reset_stone.desc: A stone imbued with magical energies. It has the power to re-randomize the current dungeon level, letting you experience a brand new set of events, search for new treasures, and fight new monsters.

health_potion.name: Health Potion
health_potion.desc: A flask filled with a refreshing draught that can re-invigorate and rejuvenate even the most badly wounded fish. Restores up to half your max HP. May be used during combat.

gold.name: Gold Pieces (GP)
gold.desc: Shiny gold pieces, worth a pretty penny. Actually, worth several thousand pretty pennies. Don't spend it all in one place.

weapon_scraps.name: Weapon Scraps
weapon_scraps.desc: Scraps of leather, iron, steel. Formerly part of someone's weapon. Maybe you could use it to make your own weapons better...

armor_scraps.name: Armor Scraps
armor_scraps.desc: Scraps of leather, iron, scales, or cloth. Formerly part of someone's adventuring gear. Maybe you could use it to reinforce your own armor somehow...

melee_weapon_01.name: Crude Shiv (1H)
melee_weapon_01.desc: A sharpened piece of fish bone. Clearly whoever made this was significantly luckier than whomever it came from. +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped

melee_weapon_02.name: Razor Sharp Dagger (1H)
melee_weapon_02.desc: A shiny dagger. You could fillet someone with this. Careful not to cut yourself on the blade. +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped.

melee_weapon_03.name: Short Sword (1H)
melee_weapon_03.desc: It's like a dagger, but longer. +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped. STAB ALL THE THINGS.

melee_weapon_04.name: Greatsword (2H)
melee_weapon_04.desc: A very large sword. Requires both fins to wield. Good news, though: it does +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped. Enjoy your murder spree!

melee_weapon_05.name: Misericorde (1H)
melee_weapon_05.desc: A knife with a long, narrow blade. Stick them with the pointy end. +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped.

melee_weapon_05.name: Longsword (2H)
melee_weapon_05.desc: A two-finned weapon with a straight, 43-inch long, double-edged steel blade. Only a foot shorter than Peter Dinklage, and much deadlier. Although Peter is a much better actor, so there's that. +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped.

melee_weapon_06.name: Swordchucks (2H)
melee_weapon_06.desc: "Swordchucks, yo! I'd be like Bruce Lee meets Musashi! Only Better! God, I'm so BRILLIANT!" +%dmgMin% - %dmgMax% DMG when equipped.

tail_armor_01.name: Popsicle Stick Tail Armor
tail_armor_01.desc: Balsawood popsicle sticks, rubber-banded around your fin. It's not pretty, but it's something. +1 Armor when equipped

fin_armor_01.name: Chainmail Fin-Gloves
fin_armor_01.desc: Someone probably bought these off Etsy. +2 Armor when worn. You'll also probably get weird looks from people, but that's hard to quantify as easily.

body_armor_01.name: Discarded Soda Can Armor
body_armor_01.desc: A set of armor crudely fashioned from soda cans that someone threw in the river. Someone else's senseless litter is your gain! +1 Armor when worn. -1000 Style.

body_armor_02.name: Leather Armor
body_armor_02.desc: A set of leather body armor. Gives +3 Armor when worn. Gives 0 Armor when it's just sitting in your bag.

body_armor_03.name: Fish Bone Armor
body_armor_03.desc: A set of body armor fashioned out of fish bones. Macabre, but effective. +5 Armor when equipped.

head_armor_01.name: Tinfoil Hat
head_armor_01.desc: Candy bar and snack wrappers that someone fished (hah!) out of the garbage and fashioned into a hat. +1 Armor when worn. Also +10 at keeping the voices out.

head_armor_02.name: Leather Helm
head_armor_02.desc: A round helm made out of leather. With some difficulty, you can adapt it to the shape of your head. +3 Armor when worn.

shield_01.name: Bark Shield
shield_01.desc: A thick piece of bark scraped off the side of a sunken log. Not pretty, but at least it's something solid between you and those who mean you harm. %armorValue% Armor when equipped.

shield_02.name: Hide Shield
shield_02.desc: A deer hide wrapped around a frame of fish bones. You're not really sure how a deer got underwater, but you're grateful for the +4 Armor it provides when equipped.
